required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The Discoveryâ„¢ Elbow Multi-Center Prospective Study (5-year Study) patients will be consented at the two year or next scheduled follow-up period for the early-enrolled patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
Eligibility: Patient(s) must be enrolled in the Discovery Multi-Center Prospective Study. The patient must consent to participation in the Discovery Long-term Survivorship Study.
In order to continue to follow the multi-center subjects long-term Biomet would like to extend the follow-up to include annual follow-ups from 10 to 15 years to document long-term survivorship. The annual follow-up will be obtained by sending annual questionnaire directly to the patients by mail. The Patient ASES questionnaire and survivorship data questions will be collected.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study terminated due to change in sponsorship

primary_outcome.description: This patient questionnaire asks questions related to pain, range of motion, work and sports activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Survivorship will be measured by the incidence of revision or removals
secondary_outcome.description: The consented Patient will answer specific questions about their elbow replacement such as; if the elbow replacement has been removed

intervention.description: patient participating in the Discovery Elbow Multi-center study

study_pop.textblock: The Study population shall be participanting in the Discovery Elbow Multi-center Study who provide consent for the Discovey Elbow Long-term Survivoship Study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Participant in the Discovery Elbow Multi-center Study
2. Consent to participate in the Discovery Elbow Long-Term Survivorship Study
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patient is not a Discovery Elbow Multi-center Participant
2. Patient does not provide consent for the Discovery Elbow Long-term Survivorship Study

overall_official.affiliation: Director Clinical Research, Biomet Orthopedics, LLC

facility.name: The Indiana Hand to Shoulder Center

clinical_study.keyword: Study participant Discovery Elbow Multi-center Study who
consent for the Discovery Elbow Long-term SurvivorshipStudy
